summary:
## Simplifying ISO

The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) sets global standards for almost everything, from technology and manufacturing to food safety and healthcare. Think of it as a global rulebook to make sure things work safely and efficiently.

Founded in 1947, ISO is made up of representatives from different countries. They work together to create over 25,000 standards, with more being added all the time. Its headquarters are in Geneva, Switzerland, and it uses English, French, and Russian as its official languages.
title: International Organization for Standardization
